, viviamo per LUI e parleremo agli altri di LUI. E certamente non dispereremo quando la vita diventerà dura. Contemplazione: Lodate il Signore, dico a me stesso; con tutto il mio cuore, loderò il SUO santo nome. Lodate il Signore, dico a me stesso,
, e non dimenticherò mai le cose buone che Lui fa per me ... amici! (Salmo 103: 1-2). Un benedetto lunedì gioioso. GBU.

Catholics believe that in the Eucharist we receive the body & blood of Christ, not a mere symbol of same. This is the very heart and soul of our faith and, absent this belief, one is simply not Catholic.
and uniting the dates of Easter...
What?
The Romans and Orthodox remain divided on what date Easter falls on, they should be celebrating the same. Key thing here is they are DIVIDED and refuse to reconcile.
I mean, nobody really knows what the actual date Jesus rose from the dead was, so does it really matter?

FYI: The Roman Church was very smart in the way they organized holydays like Christmas, Easter, etc. The Romans were used to celebrating various pagan holidays before Christianity arrived. The Church simply converted these pagan dates to symbolize various Christian events.
The reason why is irrelevant in this age. Since it does not matter to you then what matters to Christ should not be disregarded. The dates need to be united because He wants it that way.
With all the bad things that are happening in the world, do you really think the date we celebrate Easter is so important? This is the last I'll speak on this subject.
What about the good things that are happening around the world?
